meanings.definition: A substance that inhibits the action of cholinesterase enzymes.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed anticholinesterases to help with my condition.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the effects of anticholinesterases on memory.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled anticholinesterases on my lab coat, now it won't come off!
meanings.sent4: Her love was like anticholinesterases, slowing down the enzyme of my heart.
meanings.sent5: The smell of anticholinesterases lingered in the air, a reminder of the experiment.

meanings.definition: Drugs that block the activity of acetylcholinesterase.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist explained how anticholinesterases work to my grandmother.
meanings.sent2: Athletes should be cautious when using anticholinesterases as performance enhancers.
meanings.sent3: The anticholinesterases in the medicine made the pills taste bitter.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like anticholinesterases, preventing me from forgetting the past.
meanings.sent5: The classroom smelled of anticholinesterases after the science experiment.

meanings.definition: Chemical compounds that prevent the breakdown of acetylcholine in the body.
meanings.sent1: The researchers discovered new anticholinesterases with stronger effects.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often prescribe anticholinesterases to patients with certain neurological conditions.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added too much anticholinesterases to the recipe, changing its taste.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like anticholinesterases, preserving the happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with the scent of anticholinesterases, a sign of the new pesticide.
